result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Pettis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Milwaukee case 15CF1759, Waukesha case 15CF605 & Ozaukee case 15CF232.
Probation may be terminated early if restitution is paid in full.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   No DNA surcharge is being ordered due to the date of the crime.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $500 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with victims and their businesses, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: rcv'd from Atty. Hilary Edwards  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Restitution Determined  - $500.00
This total does not include 10% surcharge due Kenosha Co. Clerk of Courts.
For Restitution Order

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  An amended information was filed & the reading waived.  The DE plead no contest to cts. 1,2 & 3, found guilty. Sentence is withheld, on all 3 cts., 9 months probation consecutive to Milwaukee case #15CF1759, Waukesha case #15CF605 & Ozaukee cse #15CF232.  Probation may be terminated early if restitution is paid in full.  No DNA surcharge is being ordered due to the date of the crime  Clerk D. Smith.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Edwards.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney Edwards states that the parties are not prepared for trial.  The court adjourns the trial.  Final pre-trial set for 5/4/18 @ 11:00.  Jury selection 5/7/18 @ 8:45.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Reading of the information is waived & plea of not guilty entered.  Scheduling conference order entered.  JPTC 10/11/17 @ 1:30.  Clerk D. Smith.
Scheduling conference order

Defendant Robert J. Pettis appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 1. Information filed; reading waived. Bond continued, however the DE is advised that Judge Bastianelli may review the bond conditions at the arraignment hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for July 26, 2017 at 09:15 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 1.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Defendant, Robert J. Pettis, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   Atty Edwards states DE has been here in KCJ from resource center for a couple of days and has not received all his medication.  Atty Edwards requests and adjournment for DE to return to WI Resource Center for medication management; no objection by the State.  Court tolls time limits and reschedules hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone (Wisc. Resource Center).  Atty Hilary Edwards appeared in person.  Report has been received from Dr. Lundbolm.  Report states the deft is competent to proceed.  Deft concurs with the findings in report.  Attys concur with the findings in the report.  Court finds the deft is competent to proceed.  Time limits tolled on the record.  PH set for 7/11/17 @ 8:30am
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Defense counsel in trial.  CH adj to 6/8/17 @ 9:30am.  Defense counsel notified via email

Substitution of Br 8  filed. Tab pulled for Br.3  Competency hearing scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Atty Edwards raises issue of competency - Court orders comp exam.  Attorney moves to dismiss complaint - Arguments heard - Court denies motion.
